subtopics.name: Data Representation
subtopics.description: Understanding various number systems and data representation methods in computer systems
learningObjectives: Convert between and perform operations in Binary, Denary, and Hexadecimal number systems
Understand and perform logical binary shifts
Use Two's Complement for representing negative numbers
Explain how text, sound, and images are represented in computers
Understand data storage requirements and compression techniques (Lossy & Lossless)

subtopics.name: Data Transmission
subtopics.description: Understanding methods and protocols for data transmission in computer networks
learningObjectives: Explain packet switching and the structure of data packets
Compare different transmission methods (Serial, Parallel, Simplex, Duplex)
Understand the Universal Serial Bus (USB) standard
Implement and explain error detection methods (Parity, Checksum, Echo Check)
Understand encryption methods (Symmetric & Asymmetric)

subtopics.name: Hardware
subtopics.description: Understanding computer architecture and hardware components
learningObjectives: Explain computer architecture including CPU and the Fetch-Decode-Execute Cycle
Identify and describe various input and output devices
Compare different data storage technologies (Magnetic, Optical, Solid-State)
Understand virtual memory and cloud storage concepts
Explain network hardware components and addressing (NIC, MAC Address, IP Address, Routers)

subtopics.name: Software
subtopics.description: Understanding different types of software and their functions
learningObjectives: Differentiate between System Software and Application Software
Explain Operating System functions and interrupt handling
Compare High-Level and Low-Level programming languages
Understand the role of Compilers, Interpreters & Assemblers
Describe features and benefits of Integrated Development Environments (IDEs)

subtopics.name: Internet & Its Uses
subtopics.description: Understanding internet technologies and their applications
learningObjectives: Differentiate between Internet and World Wide Web
Understand URLs and protocols (HTTP, HTTPS)
Explain web browsers and the use of cookies
Understand digital currency and blockchain technology
Identify and prevent cybersecurity threats

subtopics.name: Automated & Emerging Technologies
subtopics.description: Understanding modern automated systems and emerging technologies
learningObjectives: Explain automated systems components (Sensors, Microprocessors, Actuators)
Understand robotics characteristics and applications
Describe Artificial Intelligence applications including Expert Systems and Machine Learning

subtopics.name: Algorithm Design & Problem-Solving
subtopics.description: Understanding software development lifecycle and problem-solving techniques
learningObjectives: Follow the Program Development Life Cycle (Analysis, Design, Coding, Testing)
Apply problem decomposition techniques
Implement standard algorithmic methods (Sorting, Searching, Counting)
Perform validation and verification of algorithms
Use trace tables and dry-run testing

subtopics.name: Programming
subtopics.description: Understanding fundamental programming concepts and techniques
learningObjectives: Work with variables, constants, and different data types
Use input/output operations and various operators (Arithmetic, Relational, Logical)
Implement control structures (Sequence, Selection, Iteration)
Create and use procedures and functions with and without parameters
Work with nested statements and library routines
Implement arrays (1D, 2D) and perform file handling operations

subtopics.name: Databases
subtopics.description: Understanding basic database concepts and SQL queries
learningObjectives: Design and work with single-table databases
Understand different data types and primary keys
Write SQL queries using SELECT, WHERE, ORDER BY, COUNT, SUM, AND, OR

subtopics.name: Boolean Logic
subtopics.description: Understanding logic gates and digital circuit design
learningObjectives: Understand and use basic logic gates (AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR)
Design logic circuits from problem statements
Create and use truth tables and boolean expressions
